subject: Mathematics - Combinatorics
05C70, 05D15
creator: Csaba, Béla
title: Regular spanning subgraphs of bipartite graphs of high minimum degree
description:
Let G be a simple balanced bipartite graph on $2n$ vertices, $\delta =
\delta(G)/n$, and $\rho={\delta + \sqrt{2 \delta -1} \over 2}$. If $\delta >
1/2$ then it has a $\lfloor \rho n \rfloor$-regular spanning subgraph. The
statement is nearly tight.

subject: Astrophysics
creator: Ahmed, Nasser Mohamed
title:
The heating of the cooling flow (The feedback effervescent heating
  model)
description:
The standard cooling flow model has predicted a large amount of cool gas in
the clusters of galaxies. The failure of the Chandra and XXM-Newton telescopes
to detect cooling gas (below 1-2 keV) in clusters of galaxies has suggested
that some heating process must work to suppress the cooling. The most likely
heating source is the heating by AGNs. There are many heating mechanisms, but
we will adopt the effervescent heating model which is a result of the
interaction of the bubbles inflated by AGN with the intra-cluster medium(ICM).
  Using the FLASH code, we have carried out time dependent simulations to
investigate the effect of the heating on the suppression of the cooling in
cooling flow clusters. We have found that the effervescent heating model can
not balance the radiative cooling and it is an artificial model. Furthermore,
the effervescent heating is a function of the ICM pressure gradient but the
cooling is proportional to the gas density square and square root of the gas
temperature.

subject: Condensed Matter - Strongly Correlated Electrons
creator: Brügger, C.
Kämpfer, F.
Moser, M.
Pepe, M.
Wiese, U. -J.
title:
From the Hubbard Model to a Systematic Low-Energy Effective Field Theory
  for Magnons and Holes in an Antiferromagnet
description:
The low-energy physics of antiferromagnets is governed by their Goldstone
bosons -- the magnons -- and it is described by a low-energy effective field
theory. In analogy to baryon chiral perturbation theory, we construct the
effective field theory for magnons and holes in an antiferromagnet. It is a
systematic low-energy expansion based on symmetry considerations and on the
fact that the holes are located in pockets centered at k=(pi/2a,\pm pi/2a).
Even though the symmetries are extracted from the Hubbard model, the effective
theory is universal and makes model-independent predictions about the dynamical
mechanisms in the antiferromagnetic phase. The low-energy effective theory has
been used to investigate one-magnon exchange which leads to a d-wave-shaped
bound state of holes.
Comment: 2 pages, Submitted to Physica C, Proceedings of M2S-HTSC 2006 Dresden

subject: Mathematics - Rings and Algebras
Mathematics - Commutative Algebra
14M12, 15A15, 15A72, 15A29, 13P10
creator: Holtz, Olga
Sturmfels, Bernd
title: Hyperdeterminantal relations among symmetric principal minors
description:
The principal minors of a symmetric $n{\times}n$-matrix form a vector of
length $2^n$. We characterize these vectors in terms of algebraic equations
derived from the $ 2{\times}2{\times}2$-hyperdeterminant.

Comment: 12 pages; referee's suggestions incorporated, new section "Invariance
  and the Quartic Generation Conjecture" added
